Build a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server in C#
=================================================

![James Montemagno](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2021/11/VwJrc4QB_400x400-96x96.jpg)

[James Montemagno](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/author/jamesmontemagno)

Principal Manager, Tech PM

[Show more](javascript:)

In the rapidly evolving world of AI and machine learning, effective communication between models and applications is critical. [The Model Context Protocol (MCP)](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/introduction) is a standardized protocol designed to facilitate this communication by providing a structured way to exchange context and data between AI models and their clients. Whether youâre building AI-powered applications or integrating multiple models into a cohesive system, MCP ensures interoperability and scalability. For developers using tools like [Visual Studio Code](http://code.visualstudio.com/), you can now integrate and leverage MCP servers in your development flow and it makes it easy to build and test MCP servers on your local machine.

With the release of the [MCP C# SDK](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft-partners-with-anthropic-to-create-official-c-sdk-for-model-context-protocol), developers can now easily build both servers and clients that leverage this protocol. This SDK simplifies the implementation process, allowing you to focus on your applicationâs unique features rather than the complexities of protocol handling. Additionally, the SDK includes support for consuming MCP servers, enabling developers to create robust client applications that interact seamlessly with MCP servers.

In this blog post, weâll explore how you can use the C# SDK to create your own MCP server and client applications.

**Note**

The MCP C# SDK is in preview and APIs may change. We will continuously update this blog as the SDK evolves.

Getting Started Building an MCP server
--------------------------------------

The MCP C# SDK is distributed as NuGet packages that you can integrate into a simple console application. Letâs start out by creating our very first MCP server by creating a new console app:

 dotnet new console -n MyFirstMCP

Now, letâs add a few basic NuGet packages for the MCP C# SDK and to host our server with `Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting`.

 dotnet add package ModelContextProtocol --prerelease
 dotnet add package Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting

The `ModelContextProtocol` package gives access to new APIs to create clients that connect to MCP servers, creation of MCP servers, and AI helper libraries to integrate with LLMs through `Microsoft.Extensions.AI`.

Starting up our server
----------------------

Letâs update our `Program.cs` with some basic scaffolding to create our MCP server, configure standard server transport, and tell our server to search for **Tools** (or available APIs) from the running assembly.

 using Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection;
 using Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting;
 using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 using ModelContextProtocol.Server;
 using System.ComponentModel;
 
 var builder = Host.CreateApplicationBuilder(args);
 builder.Logging.AddConsole(consoleLogOptions =>
 {
 // Configure all logs to go to stderr
 consoleLogOptions.LogToStandardErrorThreshold = LogLevel.Trace;
 });
 
 builder.Services
 .AddMcpServer()
 .WithStdioServerTransport()
 .WithToolsFromAssembly();
 
 await builder.Build().RunAsync();

With this code we are now ready to build our first tool that we want to expose to our MCP server.

Defining our first tool
-----------------------

Letâs create the most basic tool to just repeat back what we ask it to do. We first define our class that will contain functions that are exposed as tools.

 [McpServerToolType]
 public static class EchoTool
 {
 [McpServerTool, Description("Echoes the message back to the client.")]
 public static string Echo(string message) => $"Hello from C#: {message}";
 
 [McpServerTool, Description("Echoes in reverse the message sent by the client.")]
 public static string ReverseEcho(string message) => new string(message.Reverse().ToArray());
 }
 

In our startup code, the `WithToolsFromAssembly` will scan the assembly for classes with the `McpServerToolType` attribute and register all methods with the `McpServerTool` attribute. Notice that the `McpServerTool` has a **Description** which will be fed into any client connecting to the server. This description helps the client determine which tool to call.

Configure and run in VS Code
----------------------------

With this minimal code, our MCP server is ready for testing! If you havenât tried out MCP support in VS Code, check out [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iS25RFups4A) for a guided tour. To run our project locally, we just need to add a new server in our **mcp.json** file in your **.vscode** folder or your user settings:

 {
 "inputs": [],
 "servers": {
 "MyFirstMCP": {
 "type": "stdio",
 "command": "dotnet",
 "args": [
 "run",
 "--project",
 "D:\\source\\MyFirstMCP\\MyFirstMCP\\MyFirstMCP.csproj"
 ]
 }
 }
 }

When we go into GitHub Copilot and toggle on Agent mode, we will see our new tool configured:

![VS Code drop down showing 2 tools available](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2025/04/echotools.png)

Opening GitHub Copilotâs Agent mode we can now ask it to reverse a message for us. We will be prompted for permission to execute the call to the tool:

![Prompt asking for permission to run ReverseEcho](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2025/04/reverseecho.png) Selecting **Continue** will run the tool and pass the message to our MCP server to execute:

![Copilot showing the message reversed](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2025/04/reversedmessage.png)

Integrating with our own data and APIs
--------------------------------------

MCP servers show their power when they integrate into an existing API or service to query real data that can be used by the clients. There is a [growing list of servers](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers) available to use in clients including ones I use every day such as [Git](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers/blob/main/src/git), [GitHub](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers/blob/main/src/github), [Playwright](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright-mcp), and the [Filesystem](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers/blob/main/src/filesystem). So, letâs extend our MCP server to connect with an API, take query parameters, and respond back to data. If you have followed me at all, you know I love making demos about monkeys and I thought having a [Monkey MCP server](https://github.com/jamesmontemagno/MonkeyMCP) available to me at all times would be useful. So, the first thing I did was integrate a simple service that queries my monkey database to return a list of monkeys or information about a specific kind:

 using System.Net.Http.Json;
 using System.Text.Json;
 using System.Text.Json.Serialization;
 
 namespace MyFirstMCP;
 
 public class MonkeyService
 {
 private readonly HttpClient httpClient;
 public MonkeyService(IHttpClientFactory httpClientFactory)
 {
 httpClient = httpClientFactory.CreateClient();
 }
 
 List<Monkey> monkeyList = new();
 public async Task<List<Monkey>> GetMonkeys()
 {
 if (monkeyList?.Count > 0)
 return monkeyList;
 
 var response = await httpClient.GetAsync("https://www.montemagno.com/monkeys.json");
 if (response.IsSuccessStatusCode)
 {
 monkeyList = await response.Content.ReadFromJsonAsync(MonkeyContext.Default.ListMonkey) ?? [];
 }
 
 monkeyList ??= [];
 
 return monkeyList;
 }
 
 public async Task<Monkey?> GetMonkey(string name)
 {
 var monkeys = await GetMonkeys();
 return monkeys.FirstOrDefault(m => m.Name?.Equals(name, StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) == true);
 }
 }
 
 public partial class Monkey
 {
 public string? Name { get; set; }
 public string? Location { get; set; }
 public string? Details { get; set; }
 public string? Image { get; set; }
 public int Population { get; set; }
 public double Latitude { get; set; }
 public double Longitude { get; set; }
 }
 
 [JsonSerializable(typeof(List<Monkey>))]
 internal sealed partial class MonkeyContext : JsonSerializerContext {
 
 }

I can then register this with the built in .NET dependency service so I can use it later:

 builder.Services.AddHttpClient();
 builder.Services.AddSingleton<MonkeyService>();

This service could call your existing APIs, query a database, process data, or anything else. MCP servers are often configured to take in access tokens or additional parameters on startup so your code has the necessary information it needs to call services. In this case I am just reading from my sample monkey data. To make these available as tools, all I need to do is to define a new `McpServerToolType` and setup a few new `McpServerTool` methods that call into this service:

 using System;
 using System.ComponentModel;
 using System.Text.Json;
 using ModelContextProtocol.Server;
 
 namespace MyFirstMCP;
 
 [McpServerToolType]
 public static class MonkeyTools
 {
 [McpServerTool, Description("Get a list of monkeys.")]
 public static async Task<string> GetMonkeys(MonkeyService monkeyService)
 {
 var monkeys = await monkeyService.GetMonkeys();
 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(monkeys);
 }
 
 [McpServerTool, Description("Get a monkey by name.")]
 public static async Task<string> GetMonkey(MonkeyService monkeyService, [Description("The name of the monkey to get details for")] string name)
 {
 var monkey = await monkeyService.GetMonkey(name);
 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(monkey);
 }
 }

In the above code, I am simply returning the data as JSON, however you can format it in different ways for the LLM to process.

We can now restart our MCP server inside of VS Code and start to try it out! The power is when combining the power of GitHub Copilot and the models it calls to transform the data and apply it to software development. For example I may ask it for a list of monkeys and display it as table.

![Monkeys in a table](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2025/04/monkeylist.png)

Or we could ask for information on a specific monkey and to generate a Mermaid diagram for the data type:

![Mermaid diagram representation in Copilot](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2025/04/mermaiddiagram.png)

Better yet, if I was building a .NET MAUI app, I could have it generate the XAML and the code needed for the data I was exploring:

![XAML showing the monkey data](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2025/04/mauicode.png)

Publish your MCP server
-----------------------

.NET makes it simple to easily create container images for any .NET app. All that needs to be done is add the necessary configuration into the project file:

 <PropertyGroup>
 <EnableSdkContainerSupport>true</EnableSdkContainerSupport>
 <ContainerRepository>jamesmontemagno/monkeymcp</ContainerRepository>
 <ContainerFamily>alpine</ContainerFamily>
 <RuntimeIdentifiers>linux-x64;linux-arm64</RuntimeIdentifiers>
 </PropertyGroup>

Here, we are going to use the **alpine** container family to create a nice small image and also specify multiple runtime identifiers so users have an optimized image regardless if they are on x64 or an arm64 based machine. The .NET SDK has the ability to create the images by running the `dotnet publish /t:PublishContainer` command. Since we have multiple runtime identifiers specified two different images locally will be created. If we want to take these images and upload them, we are able to do it all from the CLI by passing in the specific container register to push to:

 dotnet publish /t:PublishContainer -p ContainerRegistry=docker.io

Now a combined image will be sent to docker.io in this case, and then can be configured in VS Code or other clients that work with MCP servers.

 {
 "inputs": [],
 "servers": {
 "monkeymcp": {
 "command": "docker",
 "args": [
 "run",
 "-i",
 "--rm",
 "jamesmontemagno/monkeymcp"
 ],
 "env": {}
 }
 }
 }

The great part about this, is that automatically the correct image will be pulled based on the machine type the user is on. Learn more about this in the [containerizing .NET apps documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/containers/publish-configuration).

Server-Sent Events (SSE)
------------------------

SSE transport enables server-to-client streaming with HTTP POST requests for client-to-server communication. With the MCP C# SDK, implementing SSE in your MCP server is straightforward. The SDK supports configuring server transports to handle streaming data efficiently to connected clients. You can see an implementation of an [SSE MonkeyMCP server on GitHub](https://github.com/jamesmontemagno/monkeymcp) and on the [MCP C# SDK samples](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/csharp-sdk). You can go a step further and look at remote MCP servers with the new [Azure Functions support](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/remote-mcp-functions-dotnet/).

Go even further with MCP
------------------------

From here you can continue to build new functionality into your MCP server for your company, community, and your services today that can be used in GitHub Copilot or other clients. The [MCP C# SDK](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/csharp-sdk) has great samples of creating MCP servers, clients, and advanced tutorials showing the power of MCP and how easily you can build them with C#.

 Iâve noticed a few comments asking how to set a breakpoint.
 
 Go to âRun and Debugâ (Ctrl+Shift+D) 
 Click the cogwheel to open âlaunch.jsonâ
 
 Make the configurations value look like this:
 
 "configurations": \[
 {
 "name": ".NET Core Attach",
 "type": "coreclr",
 "request": "attach",
 "processName":"MyFirstMCP.exe"
 }
 \]
 
 After that, you can start debugging and whenever Github Copilot uses the Tools, your breakpoints will work.
 
 Hope that helps!

 1	ï»¿using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 2	using MCP.Server.Services;
 3	using MCP.Server.Models;
 4	using System.Text.Json;
 5	
 6	namespace MCP.Tests;
 7	
 8	/// <summary>
 9	/// Unit tests for RoslynAnalysisService
 10	/// </summary>
 11	public class RoslynAnalysisServiceTests
 12	{
 13	 private readonly ILogger<RoslynAnalysisService> _logger;
 14	 private readonly string _testSolutionPath;
 15	
 16	 public RoslynAnalysisServiceTests()
 17	 {
 18	 var loggerFactory = LoggerFactory.Create(builder => builder.AddConsole());
 19	 _logger = loggerFactory.CreateLogger<RoslynAnalysisService>();
 20	
 21	 // Get the path to our test solution
 22	 var testDataPath = Path.Combine(AppContext.BaseDirectory, "TestData", "TestSolution");
 23	 _testSolutionPath = Path.Combine(testDataPath, "TestSolution.sln");
 24	 }
 25	
 26	 [Test]
 27	 public async Task LoadSolutionAsync_ValidSolution_ReturnsTrue()
 28	 {
 29	 // Arrange
 30	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 31	
 32	 // Act
 33	 var result = await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 34	
 35	 // Assert
 36	 await Assert.That(result).IsTrue();
 37	 }
 38	
 39	 [Test]
 40	 public async Task LoadSolutionAsync_InvalidPath_ReturnsFalse()
 41	 {
 42	 // Arrange
 43	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 44	 var invalidPath = "/invalid/path/solution.sln";
 45	
 46	 // Act
 47	 var result = await service.LoadSolutionAsync(invalidPath);
 48	
 49	 // Assert
 50	 await Assert.That(result).IsFalse();
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 [Test]
 54	 public async Task GetCompilationErrorsAsync_WithoutLoadingSolution_ReturnsEmptyList()
 55	 {
 56	 // Arrange
 57	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 58	
 59	 // Act
 60	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 61	
 62	 // Assert
 63	 await Assert.That(errors).IsNotNull();
 64	 await Assert.That(errors.Count).IsEqualTo(0);
 65	 }
 66	
 67	 [Test]
 68	 public async Task GetCompilationErrorsAsync_WithLoadedSolution_ReturnsErrors()
 69	 {
 70	 // Arrange
 71	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 72	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 73	
 74	 // Act
 75	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 76	
 77	 // Assert
 78	 await Assert.That(errors).IsNotNull();
 79	 await Assert.That(errors.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 80	
 81	 // Check that we have the expected error types
 82	 var errorIds = errors.Select(e => e.Id).ToList();
 83	 await Assert.That(errorIds).Contains("CS0103"); // undeclared variable
 84	 await Assert.That(errorIds).Contains("CS0246"); // unknown type
 85	 await Assert.That(errorIds).Contains("CS0161"); // not all code paths return
 86	 await Assert.That(errorIds).Contains("CS1002"); // syntax error
 87	 }

 1	ï»¿using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 2	using MCP.Server.Services;
 3	using System.Text.Json;
 4	
 5	namespace MCP.Tests;
 6	
 7	/// <summary>
 8	/// Integration tests for MCP Tools (DotNetAnalysisTools)
 9	/// </summary>
 10	public class McpToolsTests
 11	{
 12	 private readonly ILogger<RoslynAnalysisService> _logger;
 13	 private readonly string _testSolutionPath;
 14	 private readonly string _testFilePath;
 15	
 16	 public McpToolsTests()
 17	 {
 18	 var loggerFactory = LoggerFactory.Create(builder => builder.AddConsole());
 19	 _logger = loggerFactory.CreateLogger<RoslynAnalysisService>();
 20	
 21	 // Get the path to our test solution
 22	 var testDataPath = Path.Combine(AppContext.BaseDirectory, "TestData", "TestSolution");
 23	 _testSolutionPath = Path.Combine(testDataPath, "TestSolution.sln");
 24	 _testFilePath = Path.Combine(testDataPath, "TestProject", "Program.cs");
 25	 }
 26	
 27	 [Test]
 28	 public async Task LoadSolution_ValidPath_ReturnsSuccessJson()
 29	 {
 30	 // Arrange
 31	 using var analysisService = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 32	
 33	 // Act
 34	 var result = await DotNetAnalysisTools.LoadSolution(analysisService, _testSolutionPath);
 35	
 36	 // Assert
 37	 await Assert.That(result).IsNotNull();
 38	
 39	 var response = JsonSerializer.Deserialize<JsonElement>(result);
 40	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("success").GetBoolean()).IsTrue();
 41	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("message").GetString()).IsEqualTo("Solution loaded successfully");
 42	 }
 43	
 44	 [Test]
 45	 public async Task LoadSolution_InvalidPath_ReturnsErrorJson()
 46	 {
 47	 // Arrange
 48	 using var analysisService = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 49	 var invalidPath = "/invalid/path/solution.sln";
 50	
 51	 // Act
 52	 var result = await DotNetAnalysisTools.LoadSolution(analysisService, invalidPath);
 53	
 54	 // Assert
 55	 await Assert.That(result).IsNotNull();
 56	
 57	 var response = JsonSerializer.Deserialize<JsonElement>(result);
 58	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("success").GetBoolean()).IsFalse();
 59	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("message").GetString()).IsEqualTo("Failed to load solution");
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 [Test]
 63	 public async Task GetCompilationErrors_WithLoadedSolution_ReturnsErrorsJson()
 64	 {
 65	 // Arrange
 66	 using var analysisService = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 67	 await analysisService.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 68	
 69	 // Act
 70	 var result = await DotNetAnalysisTools.GetCompilationErrors(analysisService);
 71	
 72	 // Assert
 73	 await Assert.That(result).IsNotNull();
 74	
 75	 var response = JsonSerializer.Deserialize<JsonElement>(result);
 76	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("success").GetBoolean()).IsTrue();
 77	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("error_count").GetInt32()).IsGreaterThan(0);
 78	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("warning_count").GetInt32()).IsGreaterThanOrEqualTo(0);
 79	
 80	 var errors = response.GetProperty("errors").EnumerateArray().ToList();
 81	 await Assert.That(errors.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 82	
 83	 // Check first error structure
 84	 var firstError = errors[0];
 85	 await Assert.That(firstError.GetProperty("Id").GetString()).IsNotNull();
 86	 await Assert.That(firstError.GetProperty("Message").GetString()).IsNotNull();
 87	 await Assert.That(firstError.GetProperty("Severity").GetString()).IsNotNull();
 88	 await Assert.That(firstError.GetProperty("FilePath").GetString()).IsNotNull();
 89	 await Assert.That(firstError.GetProperty("StartLine").GetInt32()).IsGreaterThan(0);
 90	 await Assert.That(firstError.GetProperty("ProjectName").GetString()).IsNotNull();
 91	 }
 92	}

 1	ï»¿using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 2	using MCP.Server.Services;
 3	using MCP.Server.Models;
 4	using System.Diagnostics;
 5	
 6	namespace MCP.Tests;
 7	
 8	/// <summary>
 9	/// Performance and integration tests for the MCP server
 10	/// </summary>
 11	public class PerformanceAndIntegrationTests
 12	{
 13	 private readonly ILogger<RoslynAnalysisService> _logger;
 14	 private readonly string _testSolutionPath;
 15	
 16	 public PerformanceAndIntegrationTests()
 17	 {
 18	 var loggerFactory = LoggerFactory.Create(builder => builder.AddConsole());
 19	 _logger = loggerFactory.CreateLogger<RoslynAnalysisService>();
 20	
 21	 var testDataPath = Path.Combine(AppContext.BaseDirectory, "TestData", "TestSolution");
 22	 _testSolutionPath = Path.Combine(testDataPath, "TestSolution.sln");
 23	 }
 24	
 25	 [Test]
 26	 public async Task LoadSolution_Performance_CompletesWithinReasonableTime()
 27	 {
 28	 // Arrange
 29	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 30	 var stopwatch = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 31	
 32	 // Act
 33	 var result = await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 34	 stopwatch.Stop();
 35	
 36	 // Assert
 37	 await Assert.That(result).IsTrue();
 38	 await Assert.That(stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds).IsLessThan(10000); // Should complete within 10 seconds
 39	
 40	 Console.WriteLine($"Solution loading took {stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms");
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 [Test]
 44	 public async Task GetCompilationErrors_Performance_CompletesWithinReasonableTime()
 45	 {
 46	 // Arrange
 47	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 48	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 49	
 50	 var stopwatch = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 51	
 52	 // Act
 53	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 54	 stopwatch.Stop();
 55	
 56	 // Assert
 57	 await Assert.That(errors).IsNotNull();
 58	 await Assert.That(stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds).IsLessThan(5000); // Should complete within 5 seconds
 59	
 60	 Console.WriteLine($"Error analysis took {stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms for {errors.Count} errors");
 61	 }
 62	
 63	 [Test]
 64	 public async Task MultipleAnalysisCalls_Performance_SubsequentCallsAreFaster()
 65	 {
 66	 // Arrange
 67	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 68	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 69	
 70	 // First call (may be slower due to initialization)
 71	 var stopwatch1 = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 72	 var errors1 = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 73	 stopwatch1.Stop();
 74	
 75	 // Second call (should be faster due to caching)
 76	 var stopwatch2 = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 77	 var errors2 = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 78	 stopwatch2.Stop();
 79	
 80	 // Assert
 81	 await Assert.That(errors1.Count).IsEqualTo(errors2.Count);
 82	 await Assert.That(stopwatch2.ElapsedMilliseconds).IsLessThanOrEqualTo(stopwatch1.ElapsedMilliseconds);
 83	
 84	 Console.WriteLine($"First call: {stopwatch1.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms, Second call: {stopwatch2.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms");
 85	 }
 86	
 87	 [Test]
 88	 public async Task ErrorDetails_Validation_ContainsExpectedInformation()
 89	 {
 90	 // Arrange
 91	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 92	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 93	
 94	 // Act
 95	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 96	
 97	 // Assert
 98	 await Assert.That(errors).IsNotNull();
 99	 await Assert.That(errors.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 100	
 101	 // Validate error structure
 102	 foreach (var error in errors)
 103	 {
 104	 await Assert.That(error.Id).IsNotNull();
 105	 await Assert.That(error.Message).IsNotNull();
 106	 await Assert.That(error.FilePath).IsNotNull();
 107	 await Assert.That(error.StartLine).IsGreaterThan(0);
 108	 await Assert.That(error.StartColumn).IsGreaterThan(0);
 109	 await Assert.That(error.ProjectName).IsNotNull();
 110	
 111	 // Validate severity is a known value
 112	 var validSeverities = new[] { "Error", "Warning", "Info", "Hidden" };
 113	 await Assert.That(validSeverities).Contains(error.Severity.ToString());
 114	 }
 115	 }
 116	}

 1	ï»¿using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 2	using MCP.Server.Services;
 3	using MCP.Server.Models;
 4	using System.Diagnostics;
 5	
 6	namespace MCP.Tests;
 7	
 8	/// <summary>
 9	/// Performance and integration tests for the MCP server
 10	/// </summary>
 11	public class PerformanceAndIntegrationTests
 12	{
 13	 private readonly ILogger<RoslynAnalysisService> _logger;
 14	 private readonly string _testSolutionPath;
 15	
 16	 public PerformanceAndIntegrationTests()
 17	 {
 18	 var loggerFactory = LoggerFactory.Create(builder => builder.AddConsole());
 19	 _logger = loggerFactory.CreateLogger<RoslynAnalysisService>();
 20	
 21	 var testDataPath = Path.Combine(AppContext.BaseDirectory, "TestData", "TestSolution");
 22	 _testSolutionPath = Path.Combine(testDataPath, "TestSolution.sln");
 23	 }
 24	
 25	 [Test]
 26	 public async Task LoadSolution_Performance_CompletesWithinReasonableTime()
 27	 {
 28	 // Arrange
 29	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 30	 var stopwatch = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 31	
 32	 // Act
 33	 var result = await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 34	 stopwatch.Stop();
 35	
 36	 // Assert
 37	 await Assert.That(result).IsTrue();
 38	 await Assert.That(stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds).IsLessThan(10000); // Should complete within 10 seconds
 39	
 40	 Console.WriteLine($"Solution loading took {stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms");
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 [Test]
 44	 public async Task GetCompilationErrors_Performance_CompletesWithinReasonableTime()
 45	 {
 46	 // Arrange
 47	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 48	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 49	
 50	 var stopwatch = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 51	
 52	 // Act
 53	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 54	 stopwatch.Stop();
 55	
 56	 // Assert
 57	 await Assert.That(errors).IsNotNull();
 58	 await Assert.That(stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds).IsLessThan(5000); // Should complete within 5 seconds
 59	
 60	 Console.WriteLine($"Error analysis took {stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms for {errors.Count} errors");
 61	 }
 62	
 63	 [Test]
 64	 public async Task MultipleAnalysisCalls_Performance_SubsequentCallsAreFaster()
 65	 {
 66	 // Arrange
 67	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 68	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 69	
 70	 // First call (may be slower due to initialization)
 71	 var stopwatch1 = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 72	 var errors1 = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 73	 stopwatch1.Stop();
 74	
 75	 // Second call (should be faster due to caching)
 76	 var stopwatch2 = Stopwatch.StartNew();
 77	 var errors2 = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 78	 stopwatch2.Stop();
 79	
 80	 // Assert
 81	 await Assert.That(errors1.Count).IsEqualTo(errors2.Count);
 82	 await Assert.That(stopwatch2.ElapsedMilliseconds).IsLessThanOrEqualTo(stopwatch1.ElapsedMilliseconds);
 83	
 84	 Console.WriteLine($"First call: {stopwatch1.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms, Second call: {stopwatch2.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms");
 85	 }
 86	
 87	 [Test]
 88	 public async Task ErrorDetails_Validation_ContainsExpectedInformation()
 89	 {
 90	 // Arrange
 91	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 92	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 93	
 94	 // Act
 95	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 96	
 97	 // Assert
 98	 await Assert.That(errors).IsNotNull();
 99	 await Assert.That(errors.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 100	
 101	 // Validate error structure
 102	 foreach (var error in errors)
 103	 {
 104	 await Assert.That(error.Id).IsNotNull();
 105	 await Assert.That(error.Message).IsNotNull();
 106	 await Assert.That(error.FilePath).IsNotNull();
 107	 await Assert.That(error.StartLine).IsGreaterThan(0);
 108	 await Assert.That(error.StartColumn).IsGreaterThan(0);
 109	 await Assert.That(error.ProjectName).IsNotNull();
 110	
 111	 // Validate severity is a known value
 112	 var validSeverities = new[] { "Error", "Warning", "Info", "Hidden" };
 113	 await Assert.That(validSeverities).Contains(error.Severity.ToString());
 114	 }
 115	 }
 116	
 117	 [Test]
 118	 public async Task SpecificErrorTypes_Validation_ContainsExpectedErrors()
 119	 {
 120	 // Arrange
 121	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 122	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 123	
 124	 // Act
 125	 var errors = await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 126	
 127	 // Assert - Check for specific errors we expect from our test files
 128	 var errorsByType = errors.GroupBy(e => e.Id).ToDictionary(g => g.Key, g => g.ToList());
 129	
 130	 // CS0103: The name 'undeclaredVariable' does not exist in the current context
 131	 await Assert.That(errorsByType.ContainsKey("CS0103")).IsTrue();
 132	 var cs0103Errors = errorsByType["CS0103"];
 133	 await Assert.That(cs0103Errors.Any(e => e.Message.Contains("undeclaredVariable"))).IsTrue();
 134	
 135	 // CS0246: The type or namespace name could not be found
 136	 await Assert.That(errorsByType.ContainsKey("CS0246")).IsTrue();
 137	 var cs0246Errors = errorsByType["CS0246"];
 138	 await Assert.That(cs0246Errors.Any(e => e.Message.Contains("UnknownType"))).IsTrue();
 139	
 140	 // CS0161: Not all code paths return a value
 141	 await Assert.That(errorsByType.ContainsKey("CS0161")).IsTrue();
 142	
 143	 // CS1002: Syntax error
 144	 await Assert.That(errorsByType.ContainsKey("CS1002")).IsTrue();
 145	 }
 146	
 147	 [Test]
 148	 public async Task ProjectStructure_Validation_CorrectlyIdentifiesProjects()
 149	 {
 150	 // Arrange
 151	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 152	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 153	
 154	 // Act
 155	 var solutionInfo = await service.GetSolutionInfoAsync();
 156	
 157	 // Assert
 158	 await Assert.That(solutionInfo).IsNotNull();
 159	 await Assert.That(solutionInfo!.Projects.Count).IsEqualTo(2);
 160	
 161	 var testProject = solutionInfo.Projects.FirstOrDefault(p => p.Name == "TestProject");
 162	 var testLibrary = solutionInfo.Projects.FirstOrDefault(p => p.Name == "TestLibrary");
 163	
 164	 await Assert.That(testProject).IsNotNull();
 165	 await Assert.That(testLibrary).IsNotNull();
 166	
 167	 // Validate TestProject
 168	 await Assert.That(testProject!.OutputType).IsEqualTo("Exe");
 169	 await Assert.That(testProject.HasCompilationErrors).IsTrue();
 170	 await Assert.That(testProject.SourceFiles.Any(f => f.EndsWith("Program.cs"))).IsTrue();
 171	
 172	 // Validate TestLibrary
 173	 await Assert.That(testLibrary!.OutputType).IsEqualTo("Library");
 174	 await Assert.That(testLibrary.HasCompilationErrors).IsTrue();
 175	 await Assert.That(testLibrary.SourceFiles.Any(f => f.EndsWith("Calculator.cs"))).IsTrue();
 176	 await Assert.That(testLibrary.SourceFiles.Any(f => f.EndsWith("ValidClass.cs"))).IsTrue();
 177	 }
 178	
 179	 [Test]
 180	 public async Task FileAnalysis_Validation_IsolatesErrorsCorrectly()
 181	 {
 182	 // Arrange
 183	 using var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger);
 184	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 185	
 186	 var programFilePath = Path.Combine(Path.GetDirectoryName(_testSolutionPath)!, "TestProject", "Program.cs");
 187	 var calculatorFilePath = Path.Combine(Path.GetDirectoryName(_testSolutionPath)!, "TestLibrary", "Calculator.cs");
 188	 var validClassFilePath = Path.Combine(Path.GetDirectoryName(_testSolutionPath)!, "TestLibrary", "ValidClass.cs");
 189	
 190	 // Act
 191	 var programErrors = await service.AnalyzeFileAsync(programFilePath);
 192	 var calculatorErrors = await service.AnalyzeFileAsync(calculatorFilePath);
 193	 var validClassErrors = await service.AnalyzeFileAsync(validClassFilePath);
 194	
 195	 // Assert
 196	 // Program.cs should have multiple errors
 197	 await Assert.That(programErrors.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 198	 await Assert.That(programErrors.All(e => e.FilePath.EndsWith("Program.cs"))).IsTrue();
 199	
 200	 // Calculator.cs should have at least one error (syntax error)
 201	 await Assert.That(calculatorErrors.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 202	 await Assert.That(calculatorErrors.All(e => e.FilePath.EndsWith("Calculator.cs"))).IsTrue();
 203	 await Assert.That(calculatorErrors.Any(e => e.Id == "CS1002")).IsTrue(); // Missing semicolon
 204	
 205	 // ValidClass.cs should have no errors
 206	 await Assert.That(validClassErrors.Count).IsEqualTo(0);
 207	 }
 208	
 209	 [Test]
 210	 public async Task MemoryUsage_Validation_DisposalCleansUpResources()
 211	 {
 212	 // Arrange
 213	 var initialMemory = GC.GetTotalMemory(true);
 214	
 215	 // Act
 216	 using (var service = new RoslynAnalysisService(_logger))
 217	 {
 218	 await service.LoadSolutionAsync(_testSolutionPath);
 219	 await service.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 220	 await service.GetSolutionInfoAsync();
 221	 }
 222	
 223	 // Force garbage collection
 224	 GC.Collect();
 225	 GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers();
 226	 GC.Collect();
 227	
 228	 var finalMemory = GC.GetTotalMemory(true);
 229	
 230	 // Assert
 231	 // Memory usage should not have increased dramatically
 232	 var memoryIncrease = finalMemory - initialMemory;
 233	 await Assert.That(memoryIncrease).IsLessThan(100_000_000); // Less than 100MB increase
 234	
 235	 Console.WriteLine($"Memory increase: {memoryIncrease / 1024 / 1024}MB");
 236	 }
 237	}

 1	using Microsoft.CodeAnalysis;
 2	using Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild;
 3	using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 4	using MCP.Server.Models;
 5	using System.Collections.Immutable;
 6	
 7	namespace MCP.Server.Services;
 8	
 9	/// <summary>
 10	/// Service for performing Roslyn-based static analysis on .NET solutions and projects
 11	/// </summary>
 12	public class RoslynAnalysisService : IDisposable
 13	{
 14	 private readonly ILogger<RoslynAnalysisService> _logger;
 15	 private MSBuildWorkspace? _workspace;
 16	 private Solution? _currentSolution;
 17	
 18	 public RoslynAnalysisService(ILogger<RoslynAnalysisService> logger)
 19	 {
 20	 _logger = logger;
 21	 }
 22	
 23	 /// <summary>
 24	 /// Loads a solution file for analysis
 25	 /// </summary>
 26	 public async Task<bool> LoadSolutionAsync(string solutionPath)
 27	 {
 28	 try
 29	 {
 30	 _logger.LogInformation("Loading solution: {SolutionPath}", solutionPath);
 31	 
 32	 // Dispose existing workspace if any
 33	 _workspace?.Dispose();
 34	 
 35	 // Create new workspace
 36	 _workspace = MSBuildWorkspace.Create();
 37	 
 38	 // Load the solution
 39	 _currentSolution = await _workspace.OpenSolutionAsync(solutionPath);
 40	 
 41	 _logger.LogInformation("Successfully loaded solution with {ProjectCount} projects", 
 42	 _currentSolution.Projects.Count());
 43	 
 44	 return true;
 45	 }
 46	 catch (Exception ex)
 47	 {
 48	 _logger.LogError(ex, "Failed to load solution: {SolutionPath}", solutionPath);
 49	 return false;
 50	 }

 1	using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 2	using MCP.Server.Services;
 3	using System.ComponentModel;
 4	using System.Text.Json;
 5	using ModelContextProtocol.Server;
 6	
 7	namespace MCP.Server.Services;
 8	
 9	/// <summary>
 10	/// MCP Tools for .NET Static Analysis using Roslyn
 11	/// </summary>
 12	[McpServerToolType]
 13	public class DotNetAnalysisTools
 14	{
 15	 /// <summary>
 16	 /// Load a .NET solution file for analysis
 17	 /// </summary>
 18	 [McpServerTool]
 19	 [Description("Load a .NET solution file for analysis")]
 20	 public static async Task<string> LoadSolution(
 21	 RoslynAnalysisService analysisService,
 22	 [Description("Path to the .sln file to load")] string solutionPath)
 23	 {
 24	 try
 25	 {
 26	 var success = await analysisService.LoadSolutionAsync(solutionPath);
 27	 var result = new { success, message = success ? "Solution loaded successfully" : "Failed to load solution" };
 28	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 29	 }
 30	 catch (Exception ex)
 31	 {
 32	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 33	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	
 37	 /// <summary>
 38	 /// Get all compilation errors and warnings from the loaded solution
 39	 /// </summary>
 40	 [McpServerTool]
 41	 [Description("Get all compilation errors and warnings from the loaded solution")]
 42	 public static async Task<string> GetCompilationErrors(RoslynAnalysisService analysisService)
 43	 {
 44	 try
 45	 {
 46	 var errors = await analysisService.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 47	 var result = new
 48	 {
 49	 success = true,
 50	 error_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Error),
 51	 warning_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Warning),
 52	 errors = errors.Take(100) // Limit to first 100 for performance
 53	 };
 54	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 55	 }
 56	 catch (Exception ex)
 57	 {
 58	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 59	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 60	 }
 61	 }
 62	
 63	 /// <summary>
 64	 /// Get information about the loaded solution
 65	 /// </summary>
 66	 [McpServerTool][Description("Get information about the loaded solution")]
 67	 public static async Task<string> GetSolutionInfo(RoslynAnalysisService analysisService)
 68	 {
 69	 try
 70	 {
 71	 var solutionInfo = await analysisService.GetSolutionInfoAsync();
 72	 var result = new { success = true, solution_info = solutionInfo };
 73	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 74	 }
 75	 catch (Exception ex)
 76	 {
 77	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 78	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 79	 }
 80	 }
 81	
 82	 /// <summary>
 83	 /// Analyze a specific file for errors and warnings
 84	 /// </summary>
 85	 [McpServerTool][Description("Analyze a specific file for errors and warnings")]
 86	 public static async Task<string> AnalyzeFile(
 87	 RoslynAnalysisService analysisService,
 88	 [Description("Path to the file to analyze")] string filePath)
 89	 {
 90	 try
 91	 {
 92	 var errors = await analysisService.AnalyzeFileAsync(filePath);
 93	 var result = new
 94	 {
 95	 success = true,
 96	 file_path = filePath,
 97	 error_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Error),
 98	 warning_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Warning),
 99	 errors = errors
 100	 };
 101	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 102	 }
 103	 catch (Exception ex)
 104	 {
 105	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 106	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 107	 }
 108	 }
 109	}

 1	using Microsoft.CodeAnalysis;
 2	using Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp;
 3	using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
 4	using MCP.Server.Models;
 5	using MCP.Server.Services;
 6	using System.Text.Json;
 7	
 8	namespace MCP.Tests;
 9	
 10	/// <summary>
 11	/// Tests for the code suggestions functionality
 12	/// </summary>
 13	public class CodeSuggestionsTests
 14	{
 15	 [Test]
 16	 public async Task DirectCompilation_WithModernizationOpportunities_DetectsSuggestions()
 17	 {
 18	 // Arrange - Create C# code with modernization opportunities
 19	 var sourceCode = @"
 20	using System;
 21	using System.Collections.Generic;
 22	
 23	namespace TestProject
 24	{
 25	 class Program
 26	 {
 27	 static void Main()
 28	 {
 29	 // Can use var instead of explicit type
 30	 string message = ""Hello World"";
 31	 
 32	 // Can use collection initializer
 33	 List<int> numbers = new List<int>();
 34	 numbers.Add(1);
 35	 numbers.Add(2);
 36	 numbers.Add(3);
 37	 
 38	 // Can use string interpolation
 39	 string greeting = ""Hello, "" + message;
 40	 
 41	 Console.WriteLine(greeting);
 42	 }
 43	 }
 44	}";
 45	
 46	 // Act - Compile and get diagnostics
 47	 var syntaxTree = CSharpSyntaxTree.ParseText(sourceCode);
 48	 var compilation = CSharpCompilation.Create(
 49	 "TestAssembly",
 50	 new[] { syntaxTree },
 51	 GetBasicReferences(),
 52	 new CSharpCompilationOptions(OutputKind.ConsoleApplication));
 53	
 54	 var diagnostics = compilation.GetDiagnostics()
 55	 .Where(d => d.Severity != DiagnosticSeverity.Error)
 56	 .ToList();
 57	
 58	 // Assert
 59	 await Assert.That(diagnostics.Count).IsGreaterThanOrEqualTo(0); // May or may not have suggestions
 60	 
 61	 // Convert to our suggestion model
 62	 var suggestions = diagnostics.Select(d => new CodeSuggestion
 63	 {
 64	 Id = d.Id,
 65	 Title = d.Descriptor.Title.ToString(),
 66	 Description = d.GetMessage(),
 67	 Category = CategorizeAnalyzerId(d.Id),
 68	 Priority = MapSeverityToPriority(d.Severity),
 69	 FilePath = "Test.cs",
 70	 CanAutoFix = d.Id.StartsWith("IDE"),
 71	 ProjectName = "TestProject"
 72	 }).ToList();
 73	
 74	 Console.WriteLine($"Found {suggestions.Count} code suggestions");
 75	 foreach (var suggestion in suggestions.Take(5))
 76	 {
 77	 Console.WriteLine($" {suggestion.Id}: {suggestion.Title} ({suggestion.Category})");
 78	 }
 79	
 80	 // Test passes if we can process suggestions without errors
 81	 await Assert.That(1).IsEqualTo(1);
 82	 }
 83	
 84	 [Test]
 85	 public async Task SuggestionAnalysisOptions_FiltersByCategory_ReturnsCorrectSuggestions()
 86	 {
 87	 // Arrange
 88	 var suggestions = new List<CodeSuggestion>
 89	 {
 90	 new() { Id = "IDE0001", Category = SuggestionCategory.Style, Priority = SuggestionPriority.Low },
 91	 new() { Id = "CA1822", Category = SuggestionCategory.Performance, Priority = SuggestionPriority.High },
 92	 new() { Id = "IDE0090", Category = SuggestionCategory.Modernization, Priority = SuggestionPriority.Medium },
 93	 new() { Id = "CA2007", Category = SuggestionCategory.Reliability, Priority = SuggestionPriority.High },
 94	 new() { Id = "CS1591", Category = SuggestionCategory.Documentation, Priority = SuggestionPriority.Low }
 95	 };
 96	
 97	 var options = new SuggestionAnalysisOptions
 98	 {
 99	 IncludedCategories = new HashSet<SuggestionCategory> 
 100	 { 
 101	 SuggestionCategory.Performance, 
 102	 SuggestionCategory.Reliability 
 103	 },
 104	 MinimumPriority = SuggestionPriority.Medium
 105	 };
 106	
 107	 // Act
 108	 var filteredSuggestions = suggestions.Where(s => 
 109	 options.IncludedCategories.Contains(s.Category) && 
 110	 s.Priority >= options.MinimumPriority).ToList();
 111	
 112	 // Assert
 113	 await Assert.That(filteredSuggestions.Count).IsEqualTo(2);
 114	 await Assert.That(filteredSuggestions.All(s => s.Priority >= SuggestionPriority.Medium)).IsTrue();
 115	 await Assert.That(filteredSuggestions.Any(s => s.Category == SuggestionCategory.Performance)).IsTrue();
 116	 await Assert.That(filteredSuggestions.Any(s => s.Category == SuggestionCategory.Reliability)).IsTrue();
 117	 }
 118	
 119	 [Test]
 120	 public async Task McpTools_GetSuggestionCategories_ReturnsValidJson()
 121	 {
 122	 // Act
 123	 var result = await DotNetAnalysisTools.GetSuggestionCategories();
 124	
 125	 // Assert
 126	 await Assert.That(result).IsNotNull();
 127	 
 128	 var response = JsonSerializer.Deserialize<JsonElement>(result);
 129	 await Assert.That(response.GetProperty("success").GetBoolean()).IsTrue();
 130	 
 131	 var categories = response.GetProperty("categories").EnumerateArray().ToList();
 132	 await Assert.That(categories.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 133	 
 134	 // Check that all expected categories are present
 135	 var categoryNames = categories.Select(c => c.GetProperty("name").GetString()).ToList();
 136	 await Assert.That(categoryNames).Contains("Style");
 137	 await Assert.That(categoryNames).Contains("Performance");
 138	 await Assert.That(categoryNames).Contains("Modernization");
 139	 await Assert.That(categoryNames).Contains("Security");
 140	 
 141	 // Check priorities
 142	 var priorities = response.GetProperty("priorities").EnumerateArray().ToList();
 143	 await Assert.That(priorities.Count).IsEqualTo(4);
 144	 
 145	 // Check impacts
 146	 var impacts = response.GetProperty("impacts").EnumerateArray().ToList();
 147	 await Assert.That(impacts.Count).IsEqualTo(5);
 148	 
 149	 Console.WriteLine($"Found {categories.Count} categories, {priorities.Count} priorities, {impacts.Count} impacts");
 150	 }

 152	 [Test]
 153	 public async Task CodeSuggestion_Categorization_CategorizesCorrectly()
 154	 {
 155	 // Test the categorization logic
 156	 var testCases = new[]
 157	 {
 158	 ("IDE0001", SuggestionCategory.Style),
 159	 ("IDE0090", SuggestionCategory.Modernization),
 160	 ("CA1822", SuggestionCategory.Design),
 161	 ("CA2007", SuggestionCategory.Reliability),
 162	 ("CA3001", SuggestionCategory.Security),
 163	 ("CA1810", SuggestionCategory.Performance),
 164	 ("CA1707", SuggestionCategory.Naming),
 165	 ("CS1591", SuggestionCategory.Documentation)
 166	 };
 167	
 168	 foreach (var (analyzerId, expectedCategory) in testCases)
 169	 {
 170	 var actualCategory = CategorizeAnalyzerId(analyzerId);
 171	 await Assert.That(actualCategory).IsEqualTo(expectedCategory);
 172	 Console.WriteLine($"{analyzerId} -> {actualCategory}");
 173	 }
 174	 }

 176	 [Test]
 177	 public async Task CodeSuggestion_PriorityMapping_MapsCorrectly()
 178	 {
 179	 var testCases = new[]
 180	 {
 181	 (DiagnosticSeverity.Error, SuggestionPriority.Critical),
 182	 (DiagnosticSeverity.Warning, SuggestionPriority.High),
 183	 (DiagnosticSeverity.Info, SuggestionPriority.Medium),
 184	 (DiagnosticSeverity.Hidden, SuggestionPriority.Low)
 185	 };
 186	
 187	 foreach (var (severity, expectedPriority) in testCases)
 188	 {
 189	 var actualPriority = MapSeverityToPriority(severity);
 190	 await Assert.That(actualPriority).IsEqualTo(expectedPriority);
 191	 Console.WriteLine($"{severity} -> {actualPriority}");
 192	 }
 193	 }

 195	 [Test]
 196	 public async Task CodeSuggestion_JsonSerialization_SerializesCorrectly()
 197	 {
 198	 // Arrange
 199	 var suggestion = new CodeSuggestion
 200	 {
 201	 Id = "IDE0090",
 202	 Title = "Use 'new(...)'",
 203	 Description = "Use target-typed 'new' expression",
 204	 Category = SuggestionCategory.Modernization,
 205	 Priority = SuggestionPriority.Medium,
 206	 Impact = SuggestionImpact.Small,
 207	 FilePath = "Test.cs",
 208	 StartLine = 10,
 209	 StartColumn = 5,
 210	 EndLine = 10,
 211	 EndColumn = 25,
 212	 OriginalCode = "new List<string>()",
 213	 SuggestedCode = "new()",
 214	 CanAutoFix = true,
 215	 Tags = new List<string> { "Style", "Modernization" },
 216	 HelpLink = "https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/operators/new-operator",
 217	 ProjectName = "TestProject"
 218	 };
 219	
 220	 // Act
 221	 var json = JsonSerializer.Serialize(suggestion);
 222	 var deserialized = JsonSerializer.Deserialize<CodeSuggestion>(json);
 223	
 224	 // Assert
 225	 await Assert.That(deserialized).IsNotNull();
 226	 await Assert.That(deserialized!.Id).IsEqualTo(suggestion.Id);
 227	 await Assert.That(deserialized.Title).IsEqualTo(suggestion.Title);
 228	 await Assert.That(deserialized.Category).IsEqualTo(suggestion.Category);
 229	 await Assert.That(deserialized.Priority).IsEqualTo(suggestion.Priority);
 230	 await Assert.That(deserialized.CanAutoFix).IsEqualTo(suggestion.CanAutoFix);
 231	 
 232	 Console.WriteLine($"Serialized suggestion: {json.Length} characters");
 233	 }
 234	
 235	 [Test]
 236	 public async Task SuggestionAnalysisOptions_DefaultConfiguration_IsReasonable()
 237	 {
 238	 // Arrange
 239	 var options = new SuggestionAnalysisOptions();
 240	
 241	 // Assert
 242	 await Assert.That(options.IncludedCategories.Count).IsGreaterThan(0);
 243	 await Assert.That(options.IncludedCategories).Contains(SuggestionCategory.Style);
 244	 await Assert.That(options.IncludedCategories).Contains(SuggestionCategory.Performance);
 245	 await Assert.That(options.IncludedCategories).Contains(SuggestionCategory.Security);
 246	 await Assert.That(options.MinimumPriority).IsEqualTo(SuggestionPriority.Low);
 247	 await Assert.That(options.MaxSuggestions).IsEqualTo(100);
 248	 await Assert.That(options.IncludeAutoFixable).IsTrue();
 249	 await Assert.That(options.IncludeManualFix).IsTrue();
 250	
 251	 Console.WriteLine($"Default options include {options.IncludedCategories.Count} categories");
 252	 Console.WriteLine($"Categories: {string.Join(", ", options.IncludedCategories)}");
 253	 }
 254	
 255	 // Helper methods (simplified versions of the ones in RoslynAnalysisService)
 256	 private static SuggestionCategory CategorizeAnalyzerId(string analyzerId)
 257	 {
 258	 return analyzerId switch
 259	 {
 260	 var id when id.StartsWith("IDE0") => SuggestionCategory.Style,
 261	 var id when id.StartsWith("IDE") && (id.Contains("90") || id.Contains("100")) => SuggestionCategory.Modernization,
 262	 var id when id.StartsWith("CA1") => SuggestionCategory.Design,
 263	 var id when id.StartsWith("CA2") => SuggestionCategory.Reliability,
 264	 var id when id.StartsWith("CA3") => SuggestionCategory.Security,
 265	 var id when id.StartsWith("CA18") => SuggestionCategory.Performance,
 266	 var id when id.StartsWith("CA17") => SuggestionCategory.Naming,
 267	 var id when id.StartsWith("CS1591") => SuggestionCategory.Documentation,
 268	 _ => SuggestionCategory.BestPractices
 269	 };
 270	 }
 271	
 272	 private static SuggestionPriority MapSeverityToPriority(DiagnosticSeverity severity)
 273	 {
 274	 return severity switch
 275	 {
 276	 DiagnosticSeverity.Error => SuggestionPriority.Critical,
 277	 DiagnosticSeverity.Warning => SuggestionPriority.High,
 278	 DiagnosticSeverity.Info => SuggestionPriority.Medium,
 279	 DiagnosticSeverity.Hidden => SuggestionPriority.Low,
 280	 _ => SuggestionPriority.Low
 281	 };
 282	 }
 283	
 284	 private static MetadataReference[] GetBasicReferences()
 285	 {
 286	 return new[]
 287	 {
 288	 MetadataReference.CreateFromFile(typeof(object).Assembly.Location),
 289	 MetadataReference.CreateFromFile(typeof(Console).Assembly.Location),
 290	 MetadataReference.CreateFromFile(typeof(System.Runtime.AssemblyTargetedPatchBandAttribute).Assembly.Location),
 291	 };
 292	 }
 293	}

 181	/// <summary>
 182	/// Adapter that makes InMemoryAnalysisService compatible with MCP tools
 183	/// We'll create custom MCP tool methods that work directly with InMemoryAnalysisService
 184	/// </summary>
 185	public static class InMemoryMcpTools
 186	{
 187	 /// <summary>
 188	 /// Get compilation errors using in-memory analysis service
 189	 /// </summary>
 190	 public static async Task<string> GetCompilationErrors(InMemoryAnalysisService analysisService)
 191	 {
 192	 try
 193	 {
 194	 var errors = await analysisService.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 195	 var result = new
 196	 {
 197	 success = true,
 198	 error_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Error),
 199	 warning_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Warning),
 200	 errors = errors.Take(100) // Limit to first 100 for performance
 201	 };
 202	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 203	 }
 204	 catch (Exception ex)
 205	 {
 206	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 207	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 208	 }
 209	 }
 210	
 211	 /// <summary>
 212	 /// Get solution info using in-memory analysis service
 213	 /// </summary>
 214	 public static async Task<string> GetSolutionInfo(InMemoryAnalysisService analysisService)
 215	 {
 216	 try
 217	 {
 218	 var solutionInfo = await analysisService.GetSolutionInfoAsync();
 219	 var result = new { success = true, solution_info = solutionInfo };
 220	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 221	 }
 222	 catch (Exception ex)
 223	 {
 224	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 225	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 226	 }
 227	 }
 228	
 229	 /// <summary>
 230	 /// Analyze file using in-memory analysis service
 231	 /// </summary>
 232	 public static async Task<string> AnalyzeFile(InMemoryAnalysisService analysisService, string filePath)
 233	 {
 234	 try
 235	 {
 236	 // Extract filename for in-memory lookup
 237	 var fileName = Path.GetFileName(filePath);
 238	 var errors = await analysisService.AnalyzeDocumentAsync(fileName);
 239	 var result = new
 240	 {
 241	 success = true,
 242	 file_path = filePath,
 243	 error_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Error),
 244	 warning_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Warning),
 245	 errors = errors
 246	 };
 247	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 248	 }
 249	 catch (Exception ex)
 250	 {
 251	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 252	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 253	 }
 254	 }
 255	}

 190	 public static async Task<string> GetCompilationErrors(InMemoryAnalysisService analysisService)
 191	 {
 192	 try
 193	 {
 194	 var errors = await analysisService.GetCompilationErrorsAsync();
 195	 var result = new
 196	 {
 197	 success = true,
 198	 error_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Error),
 199	 warning_count = errors.Count(e => e.Severity == Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticSeverity.Warning),
 200	 errors = errors.Take(100) // Limit to first 100 for performance
 201	 };
 202	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 203	 }
 204	 catch (Exception ex)
 205	 {
 206	 var result = new { success = false, error = ex.Message };
 207	 return JsonSerializer.Serialize(result);
 208	 }
